File: docs/architecture/capability-abstractions.md
Lines: 1-79 of 79

‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
    1‚Üí# Capability Abstractions (Environment / Workspace / Snapshot)
    2‚Üí
    3‚Üí## Goal
    4‚Üí
    5‚ÜíKeep infra capabilities domain-agnostic in core, and move business orchestration to plugins.
    6‚Üí
    7‚Üí- `executionBackend` handles plugin execution and scaling.
    8‚Üí- `environment/workspace/snapshot` handle long-lived infra lifecycle.
    9‚Üí- orchestrator plugin composes capabilities through `ctx.api.*` and `ctx.api.invoke`.
   10‚Üí
   11‚Üí## Runtime Boundary
   12‚Üí
   13‚Üí- Orchestrator does not need to call adapters directly.
   14‚Üí- Plugin handler uses:
   15‚Üí  - `ctx.api.environment`
   16‚Üí  - `ctx.api.workspace`
   17‚Üí  - `ctx.api.snapshot`
   18‚Üí  - `ctx.api.invoke`
   19‚Üí- Runtime resolves these APIs through managers from platform (`environmentManager`, `workspaceManager`, `snapshotManager`).
   20‚Üí
   21‚Üí## Permissions Matrix
   22‚Üí
   23‚Üí- `platform.environment`: `create`, `read`, `destroy`, `renewLease`, `templates`
   24‚Üí- `platform.workspace`: `materialize`, `attach`, `release`, `read`, `sources`, `paths`
   25‚Üí- `platform.snapshot`: `capture`, `restore`, `delete`, `read`, `garbageCollect`, `namespaces`
   26‚Üí- `invoke.allow`: list of plugins that can be called via `ctx.api.invoke.call()`
   27‚Üí
   28‚Üí## Manifest Examples
   29‚Üí
   30‚Üí### 1. Orchestrator Plugin (invoke-focused)
   31‚Üí
   32‚Üí```ts
   33‚Üípermissions: {
   34‚Üí  invoke: {
   35‚Üí    allow: ['@kb-labs/infra-worker'],
   36‚Üí  },
   37‚Üí}
   38‚Üí```
   39‚Üí
   40‚Üí### 2. Infra Worker Plugin (capability-focused)
   41‚Üí
   42‚Üí```ts
   43‚Üípermissions: {
   44‚Üí  platform: {
   45‚Üí    environment: {
   46‚Üí      create: true,
   47‚Üí      read: true,
   48‚Üí      destroy: true,
   49‚Üí      renewLease: true,
   50‚Üí      templates: ['node-*'],
   51‚Üí    },
   52‚Üí    workspace: {
   53‚Üí      materialize: true,
   54‚Üí      attach: true,
   55‚Üí      release: true,
   56‚Üí      read: true,
   57‚Üí      sources: ['repo://*'],
   58‚Üí      paths: ['/workspace/*'],
   59‚Üí    },
   60‚Üí    snapshot: {
   61‚Üí      capture: true,
   62‚Üí      restore: true,
   63‚Üí      delete: true,
   64‚Üí      read: true,
   65‚Üí      garbageCollect: true,
   66‚Üí      namespaces: ['runs/*'],
   67‚Üí    },
   68‚Üí  },
   69‚Üí}
   70‚Üí```
   71‚Üí
   72‚Üí## Invoke Flow Example
   73‚Üí
   74‚Üí1. Orchestrator handler receives task input.
   75‚Üí2. Orchestrator calls `ctx.api.invoke.call('@kb-labs/infra-worker', payload)`.
   76‚Üí3. Infra worker performs `workspace/materialize`, optional `environment` actions, and `snapshot/capture`.
   77‚Üí4. Infra worker returns capability IDs (`workspaceId`, `environmentId`, `snapshotId`).
   78‚Üí5. Orchestrator continues business flow (agents, gates, human review) using returned IDs.
   79‚Üí

   94‚Üí```

    1‚Üí# Environment and Execution Boundary
    2‚Üí
    3‚Üí## Purpose
    4‚Üí
    5‚ÜíThis document fixes architectural boundaries for full-cycle orchestration.
    6‚Üí
    7‚Üí## Core Separation
    8‚Üí
    9‚Üí- `ExecutionBackend` is the plugin/job dispatch layer.
   10‚Üí  - Responsibilities: execute handlers, scale runners, isolate failures.
   11‚Üí  - Non-responsibilities: provision/destroy infrastructure environments.
   12‚Üí
   13‚Üí- `EnvironmentProvider` is the long-lived environment lifecycle layer.
   14‚Üí  - Responsibilities: create, inspect, renew lease, destroy environments.
   15‚Üí  - Non-responsibilities: plugin/job routing and dispatch.
   16‚Üí
   17‚Üí- `RunExecutor` is the only bridge between environment context and execution context.
   18‚Üí
   19‚Üí- `RunOrchestrator` controls state machine transitions and does not invoke plugin handlers directly.
   20‚Üí
   21‚Üí## Dependency Token Rule (Adapter Loader)
   22‚Üí
   23‚Üí`requires.adapters[].id` must reference runtime adapter tokens (keys from `platform.adapters`), not `manifest.id`.
   24‚Üí
   25‚ÜíExample:
   26‚Üí
   27‚Üí- Config:
   28‚Üí  - `platform.adapters.cache = "@kb-labs/adapters-redis"`
   29‚Üí- Provider manifest:
   30‚Üí  - `manifest.id = "redis-cache"`
   31‚Üí- Valid dependency:
   32‚Üí  - `requires.adapters = ["cache"]`
   33‚Üí- Invalid dependency:
   34‚Üí  - `requires.adapters = ["redis-cache"]`
   35‚Üí
   36‚ÜíRationale:
   37‚Üí
   38‚Üí- Runtime wiring is based on configured adapter tokens.
   39‚Üí- Multiple providers can implement the same token without changing dependent adapters.
   40‚Üí
   41‚Üí## Persistence Strategy
   42‚Üí
   43‚Üí- Environment leases are persisted in SQL (`ISQLDatabase`) as source of truth.
   44‚Üí  - Suggested tables: `environment_leases`, `environment_events`.
   45‚Üí- Cache (`ICache`, e.g. Redis) is optional and used for ephemeral coordination only.
   46‚Üí  - Examples: lock, heartbeat, short-lived dedupe.
   47‚Üí
   48‚Üí## Full-Cycle Review Outcome
   49‚Üí
   50‚Üí- Human review reject must use `failed_by_review`.
   51‚Üí- `cancelled` is reserved for explicit interruption/cancel flows.
   52‚Üí
   53‚Üí## Invariants
   54‚Üí
   55‚Üí- Every run has deterministic cleanup path for success/failure/cancel.
   56‚Üí- Environment destroy operations must be idempotent.
   57‚Üí- ExecutionBackend cannot own environment lifecycle state.
   58‚Üí
   59‚Üí## Minimal Config Example
   60‚Üí
   61‚Üí```json
   62‚Üí{
   63‚Üí  "adapters": {
   64‚Üí    "logger": "@kb-labs/adapters-pino",
   65‚Üí    "db": "@kb-labs/adapters-sqlite",
   66‚Üí    "environment": "@kb-labs/adapters-environment-docker"
   67‚Üí  },
   68‚Üí  "adapterOptions": {
   69‚Üí    "db": {
   70‚Üí      "filename": ".kb/runtime.db"
   71‚Üí    },
   72‚Üí    "environment": {
   73‚Üí      "defaultImage": "node:20-alpine",
   74‚Üí      "defaultTtlMs": 3600000,
   75‚Üí      "mountWorkspace": true,
   76‚Üí      "workspaceMountPath": "/workspace",
   77‚Üí      "janitorIntervalMs": 60000,
   78‚Üí      "janitorBatchSize": 25
   79‚Üí    }
   80‚Üí  },
   81‚Üí  "execution": {
   82‚Üí    "mode": "worker-pool"
   83‚Üí  }
   84‚Üí}
   85‚Üí```
   86‚Üí
